dialogue.string: 1�Well, there don't seem to be any external wounds. To tell you the truth, I don't exactly know what is wrong with him.
1�...I'm sorry, but I'm not inclined to speak of a patient's condition. Not even to the captain of the Ducal Guard.

1�I see... I suppose some things are better left unknown.I often ponder over whether to inform a patient when their disease is incurable. However, if there still remains even a thread of hope to cure that disease...
1�<Sigh>Let me rephrase my question.
1�Friend to friend, what simply happened that day?
1�I wonder if there might be some connection between the boy and that young lady, Prishe.

1�According to the rumors among the Ducal Guard, someone saw him in the central tower of the northern ruins of Pso'Xja. However, to enter the deeper parts of those towers, permission from Tenshodo is necessary...
1�I'm delighted to see my young patient fully recovered.She's awfully energetic when conscious, isn't she?
1�It appears our visitors have returned to Tavnazia.I admit being most surprised to hear the nation still existed.
1�The boy first appeared in Delkfutt's Tower.On the first floor of the tower, there is a large doorway that leads into the deeper areas of the structure...
1�Wolfgang will know how to open the door that lies beyond.Take this envelope to the palace guard post. I will be praying for your success,  .
1�I see by his reaction that Wolfgang understood the meaning of the map.
1�Where should you go? Hah hah. That's a secret,  .Though, if you think hard enough, I feel you will come to understand.
1�I knew all along Wolfgang would come. He is a good man, despite being a little stubborn.Now hurry to Delkfutt's Tower. Tenzen should already be on his way.
1�Somewhere on the first floor there is a large doorway that leads to the basement of the tower. The key you received from Wolfgang will open that door.
1�Wolfgang should not be giving you any more problems. I think he has finally started to realize what is truly important in this world.
1�From a medical standpoint, it's a miracle the boy woke up at all.I cannot explain it...
1�Why does Wolfgang need to speak with him so desperately?
1�Perhaps you should visit the Ru'Lude Gardens. I've a feeling the situation up there may be even tenser than it is here.
1�Ah, it's you...As much as I'd like to sit and chat about your adventures over a nice pot of San d'Orian tea, now is not quite the time.
1�Wait.Perhaps you know something of what took place near the Sea of Shu'Meyo. Recently I have been hearing some strange rumors...
1�Those selfish bastards! Do they think of nothing but their own gain?
1�I apologize, but there is something I must first take care of.
1�Oh, so you made it to the Manustery with that Cardian. You have my thanks. The rest depends on him, I suppose.
1�I hope he does not forget all the happy times he spent with that kind Tarutaru family.
1�Why, hello there. Are you feeling all right? You seem well enough to me.
1�Remember to stop by if you're not feeling well.
1�Oh, so he got back home safe. He is yet another victim of the tragedy of war. But...now, now...he should be fine... Just fine.
1�All you need to do is take the Cardian to the Manustery in Windurst. I wish you luck, friend.
1�Hello again. I have a special patient right now. But there's nothing I can do for, er, it... Please, would you mind helping me?
1�The patient is in this room.
1�This way, please.
1�A Goblin brought him. They say that Cardians come to a stop once their magic runs out, but it looks like this one shut himself down.
1�I heard that the Manustery in Windurst can bring back Cardians that have come to a stop.
1�I heard that the Manustery in Windurst can bring back Cardians that have come to a stop.
1�Well, if it's beyond even your ability, I wonder what we should do...
1�Quite noble of you. I wish you luck.
1�Well, we can take him to Windurst and replenish his supply of magic.
1�Yes, he will start moving again. However...
1�I believe he will lose his memory.
1�That's right. He won't remember you when he awakens. He'll live, but as a completely different Cardian.
1�Well, let's leave the rest up to  �[her/him]. You just pray for them. That's all you can do right now.
1� , it seems as if you have experienced a trying ordeal in the Northlands.
1�I have attempted to gather information from the Ducal Guard; however, none are willing--or should I say allowed--to speak of the matter, though the fear in their eyes tells much.
1�And that is not all...Recently there have been unsettling rumors that the end of the world is near.
1�Those rumors also say that the young patient that I treated--the girl who had her amulet stolen--is connected with all this in some matter.
1�I have even heard that the Ducal Guard has a warrant out for her arrest...
1�Why, if it is not...
1�Excuse me, sir. I am not sure if I fully comprehend what you are trying to say.
1�Bahamut is readying to launch an attack on the four nations? That cannot be true!
1�But if it was...
1�Have the leaders of the nations been informed? Have their armies begun preparations?
1�Control time and space...?
1�Persuade him? The end of the world is right before us, and you want to sit down and chat with the bringer of that destruction!?
1�...Understood.Wolfgang, captain of the Ducal Guard, ordered me not to reveal this information to anyone...however, I am afraid I no longer have any choice.
1�On the first floor of Delkfutt's Tower, there is a large doorway that leads into the deeper areas of the spire.
1�It is somewhere down there that the boy mysteriously appeared. A large, central chamber...but that is all I remember.
1�Ah, but there is a door--a locked door, and only Wolfgang knows how to open it.
1�While sometimes misled, he is a man who strongly believes in justice. He may feel that it is solely his duty to protect the world on the eve of its destruction.
1�We must let him know that there are those of us who also follow the same path as he.Here. Take this envelope to the palace guard post. I will be praying for your success,  .
1�If you're here to see the girl, she's been awake for the past few hours.
1�An acquaintance of the patient who was just brought in?
1�Ah, you also know the patient? You may accompany  .
1�However, I must warn you. Her condition is still quite unstable. It seems she is suffering terribly...
1�Do you two know each other? This noble warrior is the one who brought in our unconscious princess.
1�Sir Tenzen...the adventurer,  , also seems to be acquainted with the patient.

1�The patient's condition has stabilized. However, she shows no signs of awakening from the deep sleep into which she has fallen.In all my years as a doctor, I have never seen anything like this...
1� , do you truly feel that this all has some connection to that amulet?
1�If only the mysterious boy who dropped it were still here, he might help us shed some light onto the predicament in which we find ourselves...
1�What is this? Have you also heard the rumors of the strange young man who disappeared days ago?
1�Perhaps it was the boy who stole the patient's amulet. However, just days ago I heard that the boy was recently spotted in the ruins of Pso'Xja, located deep within the dreaded Northlands.
1�A soldier I treated for hypothermia mentioned that his party had seen him alone in the ruins. When the Ducal Guard learned of this, they set out for the Northlands at once.
1�Before you set off on your journey, I must inform you that the ruins are controlled by an organization known as the Tenshodo. You should probably consult with them first.
1�The clock tower? Of course I object! Every time its bells ring, the town feels so alive. I shall sign the petition, too.
1�Galmut used to come all the time. He'd limp in here after each fight so I could tend to his wounds. He was quite a little crybaby, too!
1�The petition is complete!

1�You have 
� more ?�[signature/signatures] to go.
1�Hello. This must be your first visit.
1�I am Monberaux, chief physician here at Monberaux Infirmary. My services are available for any affliction.
1�I can give advice for general matters as well.
1�So feel free to stop by for a quick chat. I'm always in.
1�The ambassador has returned? I shall stop by for a check up later.
1�The ambassador comes by often.It must be stressful knowing that international relations hinge upon your performance.
1�Take care of yourself, all right? You're always welcome as a friend, but I don't like seeing you as a patient.
1�Sorry for all the commotion at the embassy. Let me apologize. Wolfgang and I are old friends, and both of us are quite stubborn, I'm afraid. I hope you'll forgive me.
1�Wait, Wolfgang!What are you planning on doing to him!? I won't allow you to manhandle my patients like this!
1�I don't understand. No signs of consciousness for hours, and then he just wakes up and runs off...There must be an explanation for this...
1�I'm sorry you had to witness that exchange. I'd like to better inform you of what just happened, but even I'm puzzled by the events that have transpired today.
1�Are you all right?You look slightly pale.
1�Well, I hope it is nothing serious.
1�I suggest that you hold on to it. It may give us some clues as to what is really going on. It also may...
1�Perhaps I should begin my rounds in the Ru'Lude Gardens. I may be able to collect some valuable information.I've a feeling the situation up there may be even tenser than it is here...
1�You found Pembroke's friend? Excellent!
1�Pembroke, please try! He hurried here the moment he heard about you.
1�There is nothing medically wrong with her.She appears to be under the influence of a curse.
1�As far as my knowledge extends into this field, this type of curse can only be removed by the one who placed it...You must track down this person and have him or her remove the affliction.
1�There is but one more method for removing the curse...
1�The death of the cursemaker.
1�No matter which path you decide upon, if you do not remove the curse, this little girl will remain in slumber indefinitely.
1�Greetings, good ?[sir/madam]. What ails you this day?
1�Hm? A spirited lass of Hume and Elvaan heritage, crowned with fiery red hair?
1�I fear I've not had the pleasure of her acquaintance. I assure you, I'd not soon forget a meeting with such an intriguing lady.
1�I was but a child back then, interned to this infirmary, but it pained me still that naught could be done to save Sir Ragelise.
1�What? You wish to cure a friend of the same affliction as ailed Sir Ragelise?
1�No other cases were known to exist, you see, and research on the condition had stalled before it even began.

1�A supposition has, however, crossed my mind a number of times.What if this affliction weren't a simple illness of the flesh as first thought, but something spawned of sorcery? A curse, as it were?

1�Countless tomes--veritable goldmines of knowledge--are said to have survived the fires of war. I'd love naught more than to pore through them with mine own eyes, but for my responsibilities which keep me here in the Duchy.
1�Pembroke, you should stop blaming yourself.
1�Have you heard the rumors?Some are saying that the end of the world is upon us.
1�Thanks to that, we here at the clinic have lately been spending more time mending people's spirits than their broken bones.
1�(Dr. Monberaux is a fine doctor and I really respect him, but he tries to care for people, beastmen, animals, and even machines.)
1�(I think that's noble and all, but it's so hard being a nurse here. I wish I got paid. The doctor often doesn't charge for his services, you see...)
1�Oh, and please don't mention that to anyone, all right?
1�Monberaux's a fine lad. Aye, I wish every doctor was more like him. Why, today I'm fit as a fiddle, but I stopped by all the same.
1�That doctor, bless his heart, always greets us with a smile. The ladies like him so much, they've put a fan club together.
1�Come to think of it, Narihira doesn't stop by anymore. I suppose he's been feeling better ever since Galmut took over as clockmaster.
1�It would be tough at his age. But not a day goes by without hearing its glorious ring now that Galmut is on the job.
1�So the clock tower's safe? Well, bless my buttons! I bet Narihira's happy as a goat!
1�What!? They're going to tear it down? Well, of all the hare-brained ideas... I'll sign yer petition. You betcha!
1�Back when Galmut first started, you couldn't get Narihira to stop talking about him. That old gearhead looked mighty happy to find a youth who would follow in his footsteps.
1�Well, I guess those two mules had enough in common to get along. Now, run back out there and get some more signatures!
1�The petition is complete!

1�You have 
� more ?�[signature/signatures] to go.
1�Monberaux and Wolfgang have known each other since they were lads. Indeed, they were like brothers, watching the airships come and go.
1�And now one's a doctor and the other the captain of the guard. I'm so proud of both of them!
1�But you know, I hardly see them together anymore. I'm sure they're both very busy.
1�What, no more clock tower? No! The pride of Jeuno, she saw us through the war! What about Galmut? Good heavens, where do I sign!?
1�Galmut used to be a regular hooligan, but once he became the clockmaster, he turned over a new leaf and began doing repairs for us, too.
1�The petition is complete!

1�You have 
� more ?�[signature/signatures] to go.
1�WhY...??WhY must??fIghT? NOt WiSh??hArM aNyoNe.
1�I??cOwArd? NoBoDy neeD??me? I... I...
1�I??uNwaNteD.
1�Hello! Is Two in here? I heard he's here!
1�There you are...
1�Well, say something! Give me another lecture!
1�What's the matty-matter with Two? Can't you do anything?
1�And, that will make him bettaru, right?
1�However?
1�What? Wait, that means...
1�No way!
1�But I'm for it. I don't care if Two forgets about me!
1�I just don't want to lose you, Two. I have to tell him I'm sorry.
1�O-okay.
1�We'll see each other again, okay? You promise me, Two.
1�Why don't you fight, you disgusting defect! Your brave brothers are putting their lives on the line fighting for our country!
1�That's really-willy ridiculous! Cardians are built to fight!
1�You're worthless! Go anywhere you want, but don't ever show your failure of a face around here. You're bad for morale!
1�Nobody needs a spic-n-spineless defect like you.
1�How is he doing?
1�You don't exactly know?So you have some sort of theory?
1�As you wish. But that boy is an important witness. When he comes to, he will be taken in for questioning.Has he shown any signs of consciousness?
1�You need not worry yourself with the affairs of the Duchy.
1�I... I truly do not know. That is why it is crucial we question that boy.
1�If there is nothing wrong with him, then there is no reason why we cannot move him to the Grand Duke Palace immediately. Monberaux, make the preparations for his transport.
1�...And so it seems that the adventurers are using their own unique set of rules for Ballista.
1�There is also the remarkable news that the most capable adventurers in the world came together for a tournament that encompassed the greater part of Vana'diel.
1�Ballista has been taken out of our hands and placed into those of the adventurers.
1�Brenner!?

1�I remember that name. Before the Great War, Brenner was used in the selection of the Gold Musketeers.However, the competition was extraordinarily fierce, and it is said that the casualties always exceeded the number of successful candidates.
1�The reinstatement of Brenner has now been approved!
1�I think it is time to call this meeting to a close. Thank you all for your participation.
1�I am looking for Ilumida. Is she here?
1�I'm glad to see you're doing well. Here, let me give you this month's payment.
1�No, it's what my father wanted.
1�Thanks, Ilumida, but I must go. Maybe later I'll have time to visit.
1�Always at your service, madam.
1�Don't just stand there! Seal off the area! I don't want any man, woman, dog, or cat leaving Upper Jeuno. That boy can't hide for long.4
1�Kweh!
1�The chocobo looks extremely happy.
1�Kweh...(He still looks terrified of you.)
1�Kweh...(He still looks a little wary of you.)
1�Kweh!(He seems to be comfortable with you.)
1�Kweh!(He's eating joyfully.)
1�Kweeeeh...
1�Kweh!(He still looks slightly uncomfortable with you.)
1�Kweh!
1�Kweh!
1�Kweh!

1�See, Dietmund came back, just like I told you. I could tell it from his eyes.People ain't that different from chocobos, you know. You can always tell what they're thinking by taking a gander at their baby blues, or blacks, or whatever color they may be.
1�You know, you're right... , it looks like you know your axe pretty well. If it isn't too much trouble, I'd like to ask you a favor.
1�The other day, the leader of that Tenshodo outfit paid us an unexpected visit...

1�He said he was interested in going into the axe business, but wasn't sure about which one he wanted to sell in his shop. He asked me to test two new models...but I'm busy enough with the stables and don't have any extra time to go out slicing and dicing.
1�If you're not too busy, would you mind trying one out? You can think of it as polishing your skills.
1�That's great!Here, take her. I already got somebody to try out the other one.
1�Now go out and test that girl until she's as blunt as a chocobo girl. When you feel the axe has sliced her last slice, bring her back to me and we'll continue from there. Got it?
1�Yeah, you look like a busy ?[man/lady]. Can't expect somebody to help you out when there's nothing in it for them...

1�Well, I'll be! You've worked this axe so hard that I could whack Osker over the head with it and he wouldn't even get a scratch. Now I think I'll be able to decide on which axe I recommend to the Tenshodo.
1�To tell you the truth,  , I didn't think you'd be able to handle the test. I'm really impressed. To show my true gratification, how'd you like to put your axe-wielding skills to a real test?

1�Back when I was still a blazin' young'un, me and my partners used to compete over who was the strongest of our pack. There was no real meaning to it, but it was fun and helped us build up our confidence on the battlefield.
1�And after a few of those sessions, I could feel my skills getting more and more refined, until I was smashing through anything that got in my path.

1�Here, take this 3???? and head to the Temple of Uggalepih. Once you're there, all you have to do is find 6????. Bring it back to me, and you're done. Sounds easy, but you'd better go well prepared. I've seen more than a few buddies get their hides tanned by the beast that lives in that place.
1�I don't know... I don't think I can decide yet. Whack up a few more monsters and then bring her back here for another look.
1�What do you want?I've lost the #????.I'm tired of testing the axe.Nothing at all.
1�Really throw in the towel?Yes.No.
1�When you feel the axe has sliced her last slice, show her to me, and I'll decide if we're to continue or not. Or are you here on other business?
1�You've what? Oh well, the Tenshodo guy gave me a box full of these axes, so I could care less if you used 'em to shave your cat's whiskers.
1�Here, take another one. But you know this means that you're going to have to start all over now, right?
1�Don't tell me that you're throwing in the towel? C'mon now. I've got a lot of work to do, and there aren't many kind folk out there that would help an old cowboy like me.
1�Boy, you young folk these days have no respect. You give somebody your word, and then you go back on it like it don't mean nothing at all.
1�I guess I'll just have to find somebody else to help me out. Now take that axe of yours and skedaddle.
1�I knew you'd come through for me,  . Now get out there and get chopping! Take your time if you're busy with your other adventuring.
1�Take that 3???? and head to the Temple of Uggalepih. Once you're there, find 6???? and bring it back to me...but be careful now, hear?
1�Ha hah! You dog, you! I can tell by the grin on your face that you kicked that monster in the be-hind!
1�But enough with the small talk! Let's take a look at that there 3????.
1�...I take my hat off to you,  .
1�As long as there are hard-hittin' white knuckled ?[men/ladies] like you out there, Vana'diel won't have to worry about no beastmen or no Shadow Lords.
1�Now it's time to get back to work. Osker! Stop your dilly-dallying!
1�Oh, quit your whining. One of my acquaintances should be here any minute.
1�You just shut your trap, Osker, or I'll glue it shut!

1�Ha ha ha! I had you going there for a while, didn't I? Of course I remember.You did a good job with that girl. All the folks over here at the stables rave about how she's been the easiest to work with.
1�The adventurers do, too! They say she's the most obedient chocobo they've ever ridden.
1�Would I lie to you? You've become one helluva beastmaster, if you ask me.
1�Her wounds are still not fully healed, but I don't think that a quick ride around the Duchy would hurt. Go on!
1�Are you still fretting over that? Come on, take a look at her eyes.
1�They're shining as bright as yours, Dietmund.
1�Hey, hey! You're not going get all sissy on me now, are you!?
1�If all you're going to do is stand there and cry, the get the hell out of my stables! You're scaring away business!
1�Mark my words. Someday, he'll come back for his chocobo.
1�And the chocobo will gladly go with him. After all, he's a beastmaster.
1�If you can read their minds, you might have what it takes to be a beastmaster. But no teachin' can help you there... No sirree!
1�Good job! Now you're a qualified chocobo rider.
1�Now that you can read animals' minds, maybe you can become a beastmaster. Of course, I can't teach you how... You'll just have to practice.
1�The rest is up to you, kiddo. For now, take this to the stables.
1�The rest is up to you, kiddo. For now, take this to the stables.
1�If that chocobo takes to you, I'll let you ride.
1�Well, bust my buttons! You still here? You ain't got what it takes, punk. Hit the road!
1�Eh? So you wanna ride a chocobo, do ya?Ha! You don't look strong enough to even stay in the saddle!
1�How am I supposed to work with you standin' there, huh? Scoot! You ain't got what it takes to handle chocobos.
1�Why, howdy there! How you been, huh? You look fit as a fiddle! So, what can I...
1�Hey, what do you think you're... 4
1�Hey, don't worry about it.
1�You got it. He'll grow up big and strong.
1�Mark my words. Someday, he'll come back for his chocobo.
1�And the chocobo will gladly go with him. After all, he's a beastmaster.
1�All's well that ends well, right? Now you can call yourself a beastmaster. Stand tall, kiddo!
1�What's your problem? You wanna ride a chocobo?
1�How am I supposed to work with you standin' there, huh? Scoot! Or do you want to go chocobo ridin'?
1�You wanna ride a chocobo?I sure do!Not now.
1�'Zat so? I guess it wouldn't hurt to give it a try, now would it?
1�No offense, but would you mind not hangin' around here? I'm busy! I've got a flock to watch!
1�Of course ya do! Nowadays everyone wants to ride a chocobo! Why, this is a golden opportunity for you to step into the wide, wonderful world of avian delight...

1�Then again, you young people have a tendency to throw creatures away without a moment's thought. That's why there're more chocobos living out in the wild now than I ever dreamed of as a kid. You wouldn't dream of commiting such a terrifyin' act though, would ya?
1�Not again... I see this a lot these days. Look, there's more than meets the eye when it comes to chocobos!
1�But a lot of folks abandon them nowadays. That's why there's so many wild chocobos now. It's all their fault. But you've never abandoned a chocobo, right?
1�Have you ever abandoned a chocobo?Yes, I have.Nope, never.
1�You can't fool me. I know a good kid when I see one. The eyes give it away.
1�I knew it! You'll never ride a chocobo, ever! Step down, if you know what's good for you.
1�Of course you wouldn't!
1�Still, I can't grant you permission to ride so easily. The Vana'diel Chocobo Society'd never allow it.
1�I've got it... See that fine creature over yonder? If she takes to you, I'll let you ride her. Good luck, kid.
1�Yeah? Well, talk is cheap, buckaroo.
1�All right, then... See that chocobo? If it takes to you, I'll let you ride.
1�Now's your chance to show me what you're made of, buster!
1�Well, look what we have here! He's already munchin' away. Looks like he's almost ready.
1�Mister, you may be a chocobo handler, but I reckon you handle 'em roughly!
1�That kind of scum is the worst!
1�Ah, well. This doesn't really concern you.
1�So look, kiddo... You've got talent. This birdie here's almost yours. Keep up the good work, okay?
1�You got the right stuff, kiddo. So I'm sure he'll learn to like you. Just keep at it and you'll have your 3???? in no time.
1�She may be gone, but her memory will always be here with us.
1�So, did that ghost finally go to rest? That's good. Here, I want you to have this.
1�But I still wonder... What was that Opo-opo spirit doing there?
1�Please, find 6???? hidden somewhere in Delkfutt's Tower.
1�What do you say? I need someone to get 6???? that's hidden somewhere inside Delkfutt's Tower.
1�They say that a chocobo who wears one will go straight to Paradise. I never believe in such things except in times like these!
1�Do you accept?Of course I do.Well, not right now.
1�Thanks! I'm so sad over her death that I can't even muster the will to get out there myself.
1�Don't worry about it. Come back if you change your mind.
1�Now we're talking! This'll make the chocobo's spirit happy! Here, this is all I have to give.
1�She may be gone, but her memory will always be here with us.
1�So, how ya been? What, do I look sad? Well, one of my chocobos passed away.

1�We need you to bring supplies to the outpost border guards who are placed in regions under our control.
1�There is one outpost in each region. Select ??Region Info?? from the menu, and look for the areas with a small flag mark on the map. That is where they are.

1�What do you wish to know about?Nothing.Conquests.Conquest results.Donating crystals.Conquest points.The effects of controlling regions.Regions controlled by other nations.Regions under beastman control.

1�All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call ??conquests.?? You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.
1�Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.
1�Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.
1�So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.
1�Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control.They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.
1�Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.

1�Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.
1�So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike.We expect you to do your best to serve your country.

1�You can see the current state of conquests by selecting ??Region Info?? from the main menu.Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.
1�Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank.The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.
1�You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2.Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.
1�We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on.Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.
1�You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet.Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.
1�Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.
1�You also receive rank points for completing missions.Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.
1�You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests.Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.
1�You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.

1�When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.
1�If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.
1�Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.
1�Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.
1�Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.
1�As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.

1�But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.
1�Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions.If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.
1�If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.
1�The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.
1�I cannot help you. You should go find a guard from your own country.
1�Ah, you have brought us supplies. These will help us indeed. I thank you.
